channel.title: Cor.test on Statistical and R blog
channel.description: Recent content in Cor.test on Statistical and R blog
channel.item:
Start with the data <<<<<<< HEAD /post/how-i-check-the-data-2/ Thu, 12 Apr 2018 00:00:00 +0000
/post/how-i-check-the-data-2/ ======= /2018/04/12/how-i-check-the-data-2/ Thu, 12 Apr 2018 00:00:00 +0000
/2018/04/12/how-i-check-the-data-2/ >>>>>>> b3a53b4b9d3355725c97b7629b7290493b1feb90 The distribution of each variable The multi-test of correlations After verifying that there is no one missprint in the data and before starting the true statistical analysis, I check the distribution of data and relationships between factors. For this blog article, I use data of air quality available in R. The distribution of each variable To see distribution, I use a ggplot. library(tidyverse) D<-airquality # First time transform data of tidy ones D_tidy<-D %>% tidyr::gather(VAR, value, -Month, -Day) %>% mutate(Time = Month*30.
